tourName: Cultural and rural tour of Rajasthan
generalInfo:
If you are dreaming of something more than just ticking off tourist spots, this journey through western India might be just what you are looking for. It is designed for travellers like you—curious, thoughtful, and keen to experience India in a way that feels real, not rushed.

Over the course of the trip, you shall explore Rajasthan’s incredible contrasts: from the stillness of rural villages to the grandeur of ancient forts, from intimate food tastings to hands-on textile sessions with master artisans. You will meet locals, hear stories that do not make it into guidebooks.

Best time to visit: September to April

There is no rushed sightseeing or changing hands between agents. Just you, exploring at your own rhythm, supported by someone who truly knows and cares about this land.

Stay in heritage homes with local families or charming, eco-conscious properties. It's not luxury for the sake of it, but comfort that is rooted in people, place, and purpose.

We travel responsibly, working with local communities, supporting artisans, and creating space for real conversations. You'll meet Rajasthan’s tribal groups, learn traditional crafts, and get a feel for life that’s often unseen by tourists.

There is no fixed itinerary. What you see below is a sample draft. We will shape it around your interests before you book.

You won’t be passed from one contact to another. Someone from our small, experienced team will be with you from start to finish. We come from backgrounds in travel writing and photography, and we have spent years on the road here ourselves.

No hidden costs. Just clear planning, honest advice, and a warm welcome.

Over the years, we've crafted meaningful, story-rich travel experiences across India. With backgrounds in writing, photography, and corporate life, we know the country deeply. We're transparent about costs—no surprises. And we’d love to help you explore India in a way that’s thoughtful, personal, and truly memorable.

dayInfo.description: Begin your bespoke journey in Jaipur, the gateway to Rajasthan's timeless charm, and move onward to the enchanting Shahpura village. Your stay here offers a rare glimpse into an authentic, unhurried village lifestyle. Over the next two days, immerse yourself in vibrant culture with curated village walks, savoring the picturesque surroundings and captivating stories of local life. Discover exquisite craftsmanship at the bustling local markets, renowned for their intricate pottery and artisanal leather goods - each piece a testament to Rajasthan's artistic legacy. Experience sophisticated culinary delights with a farm-to-table feast crafted from the freshest locally sourced ingredients that blend luxury with authenticity.

Enjoy a three-night stay in Jaipur at a luxurious heritage hotel that perfectly blends history with comfort. Explore the city’s lively street and craft markets, famous for leather goods, glazed pottery, intricate jewelry, and vibrant textiles. Take a guided culinary tour to savour authentic local vegetarian dishes and discover the rich flavours of the Pink City. Experience Jaipur’s architectural wonders with private visits to the iconic Amber Fort, City Palace, and other historic landmarks of Rajasthan’s former capital. For textile enthusiasts, indulge in an exclusive hands-on workshop to create your own unique fabric designs inspired by Jaipur’s centuries-old artisan traditions. This thoughtfully curated Jaipur itinerary offers a rich mix of luxury, culture, and immersive experiences, ideal for discerning travellers seeking an authentic Rajasthan adventure.

Spend two nights in a beautifully preserved 17th-century mansion in Bundi, a hidden gem in Rajasthan. Wander through vibrant lanes ideal for street photography and visit Bundi Palace, famous for its exquisite organic miniature paintings. Connect with skilled local artisans in exclusive workshops covering traditional painting, blacksmithing, and silversmithing. Explore ancient villages and Mesolithic-era cave dwellings, steeped in history. Meet the Kalbeliya and Bhil tribes to experience Rajasthan’s rich tribal heritage firsthand. For nature lovers, Bundi offers peaceful birdwatching and wildlife spotting in a serene rural setting. This authentic Rajasthan escape is perfect for cultural travellers from the UK, US, and Australia seeking an immersive, off-the-beaten-track journey.

Discover the charm of Udaipur with a three-night stay at a lakeside heritage hotel, perfectly blending comfort and tradition. This relaxed itinerary offers a balance of guided tours and leisure time for personal exploration. Begin with a guided sunrise walk through Udaipur’s bustling old town, exploring vibrant spice, textile, flower, and vegetable markets—ideal for street photography and cultural immersion. Spend your free time visiting the magnificent Udaipur City Palace and the scenic hilltop Sajjangarh Fort. Enjoy fine dining at rustic lakeside restaurants serving authentic Rajasthani cuisine paired with breathtaking views. Your time spent in Udaipur combines curated experiences with the freedom to discover at your own pace—perfect for those seeking a genuine, immersive Rajasthan adventure.

Discover the enchanting village of Ghanerao, where historic havelis tell stories of Rajasthan’s rich past. On the way, visit the stunning Ranakpur Jain Temple, a masterpiece of intricate architecture. During your stay, embark on an exclusive jeep safari through leopard territory, offering a rare chance to see Rajasthan’s elusive wildlife in its natural habitat. Immerse yourself in local culture with a visit to a nearby nomadic community, gaining insight into their traditional way of life. This carefully crafted village experience combines adventure, culture, and community-based tourism in off-the-beaten-path Rajasthan.

Continue your journey to Chanoud, a peaceful village where you enjoy warm Rajasthani hospitality while exploring the tranquil countryside on a private, guided walk. Visit serene temples, a village school, and artisan shops showcasing traditional crafts still practiced today. This intimate experience offers a rare chance to connect deeply with rural life and appreciate the simplicity and charm of Rajasthan’s heartland.

Continue your journey to Jodhpur with the choice to stay in the vibrant city or immerse yourself in village life with a nearby tribal community. Over two days, discover the heritage-rich Blue City by visiting local homes and experiencing everyday life firsthand. For a unique cultural touch, meet skilled artisan potters or set off on a thrilling desert adventure in Osian. If time allows, consider extending your trip to Jaisalmer, a stunning desert city known for its historic forts, rich culture, and breathtaking landscapes. As they say, time is never enough to visit India.
Departure: We drop you to the airport or railway station for onward journey.
